title: Doctors for Covid Ethics Letters
cleaned_text:
Read Doctors for Covid Ethics’ letters to and from the European Medicines Agency (EMA). In those letters we seek evidence that foreseeable vaccine dangers were ruled out prior to human use, and call for a halt to COVID-19 vaccines on urgent safety grounds. Our first letter of warning was issued prior to clot-related vaccine suspensions around the world.

Hundreds of doctors and scientists from over 30 countries have signed Doctors for Covid Ethics’ open letters to the EMA.

On February 28, 2021, Doctors for Covid Ethics wrote to the EMA warning of clotting, bleeding and platelet abnormalities from gene-based COVID-19 vaccines.

On March 23, 2021, the EMA replied to Doctors for Covid Ethics, dismissing the group’s vaccine safety concerns.
